WorkItem.Description:
Recently, a new trigger has been added for correcter modeling of TAJ for retribution paladins. this trigger, MeleeAttack, according to the Documentation, was already applied to TAJ. however, either it seems like this has not yet happened, or that you need to update the trigger manually.
Â 
on the added SS, you can see that the trigger still is the slightly outdated MeleeHit. according to the documentation for retribution paladins, however, this trigger was supposedly changed to meleeAttack. in 2.3.18, this is not the case, it seems.
WorkItem.Summary: [Items] Tiny Abomination In a Jar: trigger not updated yet

Comments.Message:
It was changed in 2.3.16 item parsing to use the new trigger. And it will use this trigger if you do an update from wowhead/armory.

It's supposed to get updated in the default item cache as well, but apparently it hasn't.  I even pointed astrylian to the fact the item cache needs updating after the 2.3.17 release :-(

Time to poke the bear again.

Doesn't seem to be modeled for enhancement shaman atm. Can edit the item and the special effect is selected for both the heroic and normal version, but the items are way down on the list about where the 85 hit alone would place them.

Only Rawr.Ret is currently having any kind of provision for the mote of anger effect.  So yes, all other models will have TAJ as just being a hit proc with nothing else.
If you feel that Enhance should add this effect with good reason (I suspect it's going to be rather poor for enhance), then open a new issue for Enhance.

It's BiS for ret because of all the extra procable abilities (hence the new trigger) and because the extra 50% weapon swing does 100% seal damage.
Not sure who this is now aimed at now, but TAiJ is modeled for enhancement shaman using the meleeAttack trigger.  Not sure how accurate it is compared to values from EnhSim, but its there.
